title: (x) Unitus logo sans - Myriad (customized) {Naoise Ó Conchubhair}
content:
Hi all,

Can anyone help me ID this font:

[http://www.unitus.com/logo.gif](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.unitus.com/logo.gif "http://www.unitus.com/logo.gif")

Thanks  
Lee
author: reboot

comments.content:
Not a lot to go on -- the i and the t are probably customized, the u an n are fairly generic, and the the sample's too small to get much info from the s.

The bold/black weight humanist sans like Frutiger or Myriad would get you pretty close.

Thanks again, I have printed material for these guys, will scan it when I get a moment.

Thanks  
Lee

[Erik Spiekermann](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Erik%20Spiekermann) likes to do such a ‘some-serif i’, check out [Officina](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_officina_sans/), [Info](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_info_text_ot/) or [Unit](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/fontfont/ff_unit_1_pro/).  
F

A "public font forgery" made by URW is called "Unitus"

see [http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworksm.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworksm.pdf "http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworksm.pdf"), page 17

and [http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworks.pdf](http://web.archive.org/web/20131017025826/http:/www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworks.pdf "http://www.sanskritweb.net/forgers/euroworks.pdf"), page 8

quod erat misdemonstrandum :-)
